description:
When tragedy struck Riki Naoe as a child, he was rescued from grief over his parent's deaths when four other kids "recruited" him for their group—the "Little Busters." Now in high school, Riki and the other Busters are still fast friends, and though their vision of being heroes for justice may have faded, they'd still do anything for each other. Which is why Riki is now on TWO special missions. The not so secret one: recruiting new members so the Busters can form a baseball team. Preferably FEMALE recruits, as the current dude/babe ratio is an inconvenient 4 to 1. The OTHER mission, though... That's the strange one. Because Riki and Rin, the group's singular girl, are receiving odd messages, delivered by cats, concerning the existence of a "secret world" and assigning them tasks they have to complete. Were their youthful dreams of being crusaders not so fanciful after all? Or is there something even more vital at stake? Between steeling his courage to talk to girls, dealing with his own narcolepsy and facing his feelings concerning Rin, Riki may just need the strength of a superhero to solve the ultimate mystery of the Little Busters!

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Baseball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of baseball.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

node.description:
__Graduated:__ Chuukyou University (Department of Psychology)

__Introduction:__
Jun Maeda is a Japanese scriptwriter, lyricist, composer and music producer. He is known as one of the founding members of the software company Key, and he is the main composer and original creator for most of Key's visual novels. His most notable works are Kanon (Mai and Makoto routes), Air, Clannad, Angel Beats!, Tomoyo After, and Little Busters!. Maeda also worked on Summer Pockets, which he claimed "needed to make readers cry or it would mean the end for Key".

__Biography:__
Before forming Key, Maeda worked for the company Tactics where he had a hand in the creation of two games for that company: Moon and One: Kagayaku Kisetsu e.

__Graduated:__ Chuukyou University (Department of Psychology)

__Introduction:__
Jun Maeda is a Japanese scriptwriter, lyricist, composer and music producer. He is known as one of the founding members of the software company Key, and he is the main composer and original creator for most of Key's visual novels. His most notable works are Kanon (Mai and Makoto routes), Air, Clannad, Angel Beats!, Tomoyo After, and Little Busters!. Maeda also worked on Summer Pockets, which he claimed "needed to make readers cry or it would mean the end for Key".

__Biography:__
Before forming Key, Maeda worked for the company Tactics where he had a hand in the creation of two games for that company: Moon and One: Kagayaku Kisetsu e.

__Birthplace:__ Hokkaido Prefecture, Japan

__Takeshi Ozaki__ is a Japanese guitarist, composer and arranger, who is known as the main arranger in music production group I've Sound.

Key is a Japanese visual novel studio. It is known for making dramatic and plot-oriented visual novels. Some of their most famous works include CLANNAD, planetarian, and Little Busters!, among others. Several of their visual novels have received anime adaptations, making them quite well-known even outside of the visual novel community.

They've also formed Key Sounds Label for their music tracks, and they produced an Internet radio show called Key Net Radio which is now defunct as of 2010. Key works under the publishing company Visual Arts, where it originally sprung out of.
Musical composer, widely known for his work in Air TV, Kanon, Clannad, Little Busters, and other Key pieces.
Musical composer, widely known for his work in Air TV, Kanon, Clannad, Little Busters, and other Key pieces.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hinoueitaru) | [Website](https://hinoueitaru.com/)
Artist for various bishoujo games, mainly Key.

[Twitter](https://x.com/togoshimagome?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor)

He was composed music for Key (1999-2006) and other VisualArt's branches. 
His works include contributions to the soundtracks of Air, Clannad, Planetarian, Little Busters, Tomoyo After, Fairchild, 5, Sakura no Ki Shita de, Oshikake Princess, Maiden Halo, and Alma: Zutto Soba ni.
Originating from [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/) where he studied under [Atsuko Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/102141/).

[Website](https://rita-official.info) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Ritaco25) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rita_(Japanese_singer) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/理多)

Rita Japanese voice actress, singer, and lyricist from Osaka, Japan. The majority of her work is dealt with adult visual novels. Her most notable role is performing all the vocal music in Key's visual novel Little Busters! and the OP and ED themes in JC Staff's anime adaptation.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/iktd13_)

Na-Ga is a male Japanese artist who is employed as a graphic designer and illustrator for the company Key known for such famous visual novels as Kanon, Air, and Clannad among others. Prior to working for Key, he was employed by the visual novel company Pearl Soft. Na-Ga has been working for Key since the production of Air as one of the computer graphic artists, but was able to majorly contribute to character design in Key's sixth visual novel Little Busters! with Itaru Hinoue, along with the later released Little Busters! Ecstasy and Kud Wafter. For Key's ninth title Rewrite, Na-Ga contributed to the game's computer graphics.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hal_i_00)

Married to fellow animator [Shingo Adachi](https://anilist.co/staff/110189/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Nakazawa0109)

Tomoyuki Nakazawa is a Japanese composer, arranger and music producer. He is a former member of the music unit I've.

__Residency:__ Chiba Prefecture, Japan

__Manabu Miwa__, better known as Manack, is a Japanese composer and arranger known for his composition and arrangement in popular visual novels such as Yosuga no Sora, Little Busters!, Kud Wafter and most recently, Rewrite.

__[Website](https://manabumiwa.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ManabuMiwa)__

Shimada graduated from the Department of Education at Waseda University. In 1981, when she was in her third university year, she learned that Toei Douga was recruiting new employees and took an exam to become a trainee director. The studio's policy at the time was not to employ women as directors, and although she scored top marks in the exam, she was encouraged to try writing screenplays instead. She made her debut with a script for episode 42 of Dr. Slump: Arale-chan, which was aired on 10 February 1982. After that, she established a successful career in scriptwriting. On 15 December 2017, she passed away at age 58 from an undisclosed disease.
Kouhei Kawase is a Japanese producer, composer and radio personality.

__[Website](http://www.mintjam.net/mj/)__

MintJam is a musical group. Current Members: a2c setzer TERRA  Former Members: kya A.Koga

PMMK (PostMärchen by Minato Kawai) is a two member group formed in 1999.  Members Minato Kawai (川相 湊): Direction, Design Rintaro Iwashita (岩下 倫太郎): Composition, Arrangement  The group is notable for being in charge of the majority of the BGM for Little Busters!.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YooheySuzuki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鈴木洋平_(アニメ演出家))

Youhei Suzuki is a director and former director of photography formerly working for [J.C.Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/JC-Staff). Currently freelance.

Not to be confused with the producer of the same name Youhei Suzuki (鈴木洋平).

[Blog](http://wptpw.blog76.fc2.com/)

Originating from [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).
Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).
Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).
